jervis.lang
[Groovy] Class lifecycleGenerator

java.lang.Object
  jervis.lang.lifecycleGenerator

class lifecycleGenerator
extends Object

WIP: Docs will be written once this class has stabilized.

Sample usage

import jervis.lang.lifecycleGenerator
def x = new lifecycleGenerator()
x.loadYaml('language: ruby\nrvm: 2.1.0\njdk: oraclejdk8')
x.folder_listing = ['Gemfile.lock']
println x.generateAll()

Property Summary
ArrayList folder_listing

This is a folder listing of the root of the repository so that scripts can be conditionally generated depending on build tool is being used.

def jervis_yaml

Contains the Jervis YAML loaded as an object.
String lifecycle_key

The value is the key to be looked up in the lifecycles file by default when determining how to generate scripts.

def lifecycle_obj

An instance of the lifecycleValidator class which has loaded a lifecycles file.
def toolchain_obj

An instance of the toolchainValidator class which as loaded a toolchains file.
String[] yaml_keys

A quick access variable for what root keys are in the loaded Jervis YAML.
def yaml_language

A quick access variable for what language is selected for the loaded Jervis YAML.
 
Constructor Summary
lifecycleGenerator()

The default class instantiator which loads the repository lifecycles and toolchains file from the resources directory.

Property Detail

folder_listing

ArrayList folder_listing
This is a folder listing of the root of the repository so that scripts can be conditionally generated depending on build tool is being used. This way we can do neat things like generate different script output depending on if there's a build.gradle, pom.xml, or build.xml. loadYaml() should be called before this.

jervis_yaml

def jervis_yaml
Contains the Jervis YAML loaded as an object.

lifecycle_key

String lifecycle_key
The value is the key to be looked up in the lifecycles file by default when determining how to generate scripts. This is set when a list of files is set in the folder_listing.

lifecycle_obj

def lifecycle_obj
An instance of the lifecycleValidator class which has loaded a lifecycles file.

toolchain_obj

def toolchain_obj
An instance of the toolchainValidator class which as loaded a toolchains file.

yaml_keys

String[] yaml_keys
A quick access variable for what root keys are in the loaded Jervis YAML.

yaml_language

def yaml_language
A quick access variable for what language is selected for the loaded Jervis YAML.

 
Constructor Detail

lifecycleGenerator

lifecycleGenerator()
The default class instantiator which loads the repository lifecycles and toolchains file from the resources directory.

 
Method Detail

excludeFilter

String excludeFilter()
This function generates a Jenkins groovy expression from Jervis YAML which will be used to exclude matrix build combinations. This is typically done from a a matrix exclusion in the form of a whitelist or blacklist.
Returns:
A String which is a simple groovy expression.

generateAfterFailure

String generateAfterFailure()
Generate the after_failure shell script based on the Jervis YAML or taking defaults from the lifecycles file.
Returns:
A shell script which is executed after a failed build.

generateAfterScript

String generateAfterScript()
Generate the after_script shell script based on the Jervis YAML or taking defaults from the lifecycles file.
Returns:
A shell script which is executed after every build.

generateAfterSuccess

String generateAfterSuccess()
Generate the after_success shell script based on the Jervis YAML or taking defaults from the lifecycles file.
Returns:
A shell script which is executed after a successful build.

generateAll

String generateAll()

generateBeforeInstall

String generateBeforeInstall()
Generate the before_install shell script based on the Jervis YAML or taking defaults from the lifecycles file.
Returns:
A portion of a bash script preparing for installing dependencies.

generateBeforeScript

String generateBeforeScript()
Generate the before_script shell script based on the Jervis YAML or taking defaults from the lifecycles file.
Returns:
A portion of a bash script preparing the system for running unit tests.

generateInstall

String generateInstall()
Generate the install shell script based on the Jervis YAML or taking defaults from the lifecycles file.
Returns:
A portion of a bash script which will install dependencies.

generateScript

String generateScript()
Generate the script shell script based on the Jervis YAML or taking defaults from the lifecycles file.
Returns:
A portion of a bash script running unit tests.

generateToolchainSection

String generateToolchainSection()
Generate the toolchains shell script based on the Jervis YAML or taking defaults from the toolchains file.
Returns:
A bash script setting up the toolchains for building.

isMatrixBuild

Boolean isMatrixBuild()
This will check if the loaded YAML is a matrix build. The requirements for it to be a matrix build is that it must be a matrix specifically for the selected language and the array for the section must be greater than 1.

For example the following YAML would not produce a matrix build.

language: groovy
env: foo=bar
language: groovy
env:
  - foo=bar

However, the following YAML will produce a matrix build. 

language: groovy
env:
  - foobar=foo
  - foobar=bar
Returns:
true if a matrix build will be generated or false if it will just be a regular build.

loadLifecycles

void loadLifecycles(String file)
Load a lifecycles file so that default scripts can be generated. Lifecycles provide the build portions of the script. This project comes with a lifecycles file which gets loaded by default when you instantiate this class. The path to the lifecycles in this repository relative to the repository root is /src/resources/lifecycles.json. This can be overridden by calling this method.
Parameters:
file - A path to a lifecycles file.

loadToolchains

void loadToolchains(String file)
Load a toolchains file so that default scripts can be generated. Toolchains provide the default tool setup of the script (e.g. what version of Java will be used). This project comes with a toolchains file which gets loaded by default when you instantiate this class. The path to the toolchains in this repository relative to the repository root os /src/resources/toolchains.json. This can be overridden by calling this method.
Parameters:
file - A path to a toolchains file.

loadYaml

void loadYaml(String raw_yaml)
Load Jervis YAML to be interpreted. This YAML will be used to generate the build scripts and components of a Jenkins job.

setFolder_listing

void setFolder_listing(ArrayList listing)
This function sets the folder_listing and based on the listing conditionally sets lifecycle_key. This uses the fileExistsCondition and fallbackKey from the lifecycles file to determine the contents of lifecycle_key. loadYaml() should be called before this.
Parameters:
listing - An ArrayList which is a list of files from a directory path in a repository.
